definition: to go/to visit (e.g. another country)/to attend (a banquet etc)
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
surname Bu
to divine/to forecast or estimate/(of a place to live etc) to choose
to hurry/to rush
to do at all costs/to make an all-out effort
to rush to/to hurry to
(of troops) to depart for/to head for
to keep an appointment
to advance dauntlessly in wave upon wave (idiom)
to go to a meeting
to attend a banquet
to travel to take up a new post
to go through water and tread on fire (idiom); not afraid of any difficulty
lit. to go among enemies with only one's sword (idiom)/fig. to go alone into enemy lines
to dispatch (troops to the front)
to visit the Yellow Springs/to die
heroically sacrificing one's life (idiom); to sacrifice oneself fervently to the cause
joint participation/to go together

sentences.english: The sister cried her eyes out at the loss of her necklace.
sentences.chinese: 姐姐丟了項鍊以後，哭得死赴活來。

sentences.english: He crashed the glass against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 他把玻璃猛力地向牆上摔赴。

sentences.english: The first proposing Chen Duxiu goes to Moscow was Far East Bureau.
sentences.chinese: 共產國際代表主張陳獨秀赴莫斯科目的是懲罰他。

sentences.english: He was a romantic who went off to the South Seas to paint pictures.
sentences.chinese: 他遠赴南海去繪畫，是個富有浪漫氣質的人。

sentences.english: We have Chinese restaurant and a western-style restaurant. Which one do you prefer?
sentences.chinese: 我們有中餐廳和西餐廳，你願意赴什麼？

sentences.english: Headmaster Liao Wensheng visited Korea for research.
sentences.chinese: 廖文勝校長赴韓國訪問考察。

sentences.english: As we were late we taxied to the stat .
sentences.chinese: 因爲我們晚了，乘出租汽車赴車站。

sentences.english: He was beginning to look thinner and very discouraged.
sentences.chinese: 他逐漸地看上赴越來越瘦，然而而且神情沮喪。

sentences.english: As for myself I doubt I'll ever go on a date.
sentences.chinese: 至於說我自己，我很懷疑我究竟會不會去赴一次約會。

sentences.english: Please be advised that I will have a five-day business trip to Chicago effective from today night.
sentences.chinese: 特此通知，小弟將於今晚乘機遠赴芝加哥公幹五天。

sentences.english: So there is no question of guest wanting to cancel their room reservations with Laguna.
sentences.chinese: 毫無疑問，遊客會考慮取消赴拉古娜酒店的訂單。

sentences.english: After Flagstaff, we'll go to San Diego.
sentences.chinese: 到佛拉格斯塔夫之後，我們赴聖迭戈吧。

sentences.english: Tashi then went on to the University of New Delhi to gain a Bachelor of Arts degree in Sociology.
sentences.chinese: 後來扎西赴新德里大學取得社會學學士。

sentences.english: Ding Yanyong travels to Japan, and he enters the Tokyo Art School the following year.
sentences.chinese: 丁衍庸赴日留學，翌年入東京美術學校。

sentences.english: Artists from the 798 Art District who are bound for New York to attend an international exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 即將赴紐約參加國際展覽的七九八藝術家。

sentences.english: After that, thousands of flowers come out for the banquet of spring season.
sentences.chinese: 接着就熱鬧起來，百花綻放，來撲赴春天的盛宴。

definition: to travel to (a distant place)
to rush to/to hurry to
to hurry/to rush
to leave for/to proceed towards/to go
to travel to (a place where duty calls)
to set out on a journey
to return to one's country
to return to one's home country
at sb's invitation/on invitation
to go home (to one's native country)/to return from abroad
to come to China
to visit China
(of troops) to depart for/to head for
to visit/to call on/to seek/to inquire/to investigate
joint participation/to go together
old variant of 攜|携[xie2]
